csl:
<style xmlns="http://purl.org/net/xbiblio/csl" class="in-text" xml:lang="en">
    <citation>
        <layout>
            <text value="hello"/>
        </layout>
    </citation>
    <bibliography>
        <layout>
            <group delimiter=" ">
                <group delimiter=", ">
                    <names variable="author">
                        <name/>
                    </names>
                    <text variable="title"/>
                </group>
                <date variable="issued" prefix="(" suffix=")">
                    <date-part name="year"/>
                </date>
            </group>
            <text variable="abstract" display="block"/>
        </layout>
    </bibliography>
</style>

input.abstract: An interesting book by an interesting author.
input.title: Book A

input.abstract: An old contribution to a new field.
input.title: Book B

result:
• John Smith, Book A (2000)An interesting book by an interesting author.
  • Robert Jones, Book B (2001)An old contribution to a new field.
